intro: Notopleura nepokroeffiae, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal rock fig, is a small, evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
